definitions.definition: A line drawn on the ground, as one used in playing hopscotch.
A block for a wheel or other round object; a chock, wedge, prop, or other support, to prevent slipping.
definitions.example: a scotch for a wheel or a log on inclined ground

definitions.definition: To cut or score; to wound superficially.

definitions.example: The rain scotched his plans of going to the beach.

definitions.definition: To debunk or discredit an idea or rumor.
definitions.example: The prime minister scotched rumors of his resignation.

definitions.definition: To block a wheel or other round object.
definitions.example: The workers stopped the rig on an incline and scotched the wheels.

definitions.definition: To dress (stone) with a pick or pointed instrument.
To beat yarn in order to break up slugs and align the threads.
definitions.example: Yarn is scotched immediately after it has been dried and while it is still warm. http//www.google.com/patents?id=DXdGAAAAEBAJ&pg=PP3&vq=scotched&dq=scotching

definitions.definition: (as a plural noun, the Scotch) The people of Scotland.
definitions.example: The Scotch are a hardy bunch.

definitions.definition: Whisky distilled in Scotland, especially from malted barley.
definitions.example: Paul has drunk a lot of Scotch.
My favorite Scotches are Glenlivet and Laphroaig.
